summary.p: 9 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 57; Qurʾānic Text: Q 9:33-9:42, Q 18:99-18:102, Q 19:21-19:25; 6 lines per page; Dimensions: 240 x 165mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragment Arabe 348 (c) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 57
9 fol. 165×240 mm (1.455). Support: thin semitransparent parchment of yellowish color. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: fragments of two quires; fol. 1 and 6, 3 and 4, 8 and 9 are bifolia, fol. 2, 5, 7 are singletons with stubs.
I: S H1F H2F S H3F / F4H F5H S F6H F7H
II: H8F / F9H
Text layout: 96×162/165 mm (1.666), 6 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: round red and green dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – teardrop-shaped medallion (resembling type 5.1.1) in gold and colors, in the line; for groups of five verses – golden letter ﻪ (hā) (fol. 2r); for groups of ten verses – round medallions (“enterlacs” and type 3.B.I) in gold and colors, with the inscribed verse numbers (اربعون – fol. 6r, مائة – fol. 8r, عشرون – fol. 9r).

Inscriptions: numbers of surahs and verses inscribed in pencil on the upper margins of all sheets in Roman and Arabic letters; verse numbers are also marked in ink in the text and in pencil on the margins; the word “variante” inscribed on the lower margin of fol. 5r.
Stitching: thread is preserved in the punctures of the fold of the first quire.
Defects: minor stains; margins slightly damaged; tear on the outer margin of fol. 9-10; parchment slightly damaged by aggressive ink on fol. 2, 5, 9; ink peeling off on the flesh side of some sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with the old accession number “BB” and brief description in French, in brown ink; old accession numbers “B. 35 / 1124” inscribed in red pencil; on the verso side the address “Q. des Grands Augustins 27”.
Old accession numbers: ВВ (on the wrapping), 1124 (on the wrapping), B. 35 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–7v. Surah 9, verses 33(33)-42(42). Incipit: [رسو]له بالهدى . Explicit: لو كان عر[ضاً] .
Fol. 8r–8v. Surah 18, verses 99(99)-102(102). Incipit: [في بعض] وينفخ في الصور . Explicit: جهنم للكافرين نز[لاً] .
Fol. 9r–9v. Surah 19, verses 21(21)-25(25). Incipit: [هو على هين] ولنجعله اية للناس . Explicit: وهذي اليك يحذ[ع النخلة] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 348c (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
Two detail images of verse markers can be seen on the website of the NLR (No. 17 and 22).
